title: TELL ME WHAT EVERYONE HATES ABOUT THIS PATCH HOLY FUCK. ITS FINE.

replies.body:
So the biggest issue I have with all the hate is that this is the FIRST PRESEASON patch. Add to that it's the biggest patch I've ever seen (it's a beast this one) and of course there's going to be problems with it. Yeah they overcompensated some AD champs, especially crit champs and the ADCs that got changed. Yeah they're gonna have to give the mana changes some tuning. But this is the FIRST patch. 

As far as overall balance, and even for individual champions, PBE testing cannot compare to live testing no matter how hard it tries for one simple reason - the population is not large enough. With that in mind, it'd be great if people would say "ok I think Graves is too strong" Instead of "OMG GRAVES IS SO OP RITO YOU'RE BREAKING THIS FKING GAME OMG I'M QUITTING". Seriously guys, give it AT LEAST one patch, preferably two or three until you start getting so worried. 

Most if not all of the issues people are having tantrums about Riot is very aware of and will never make it into next season. This is what the preseason is for, they roll out massive game-changing patches then tune them in the couple months they have till the next season. Preseason is when the game evolves the most, and thus when the balance shifts the most. I.E there's always going to be balance issues in preseason, report it and get over it, you can't balance a patch like that overnight, nevermind right from minute one.

>Add to that it's the biggest patch I've ever seen (it's a beast this one)

Pretty sure it's the biggest patch in terms of words, or even subjects (That right hand bar that gives you the links to all the types of changes, yeah that doesn't fit on my shitty laptop screen)
Yeah for the first time ever I couldn't be fucked reading everything in the patch loool

This comment explains this whole post
"TELL ME WHAT EVERYONE HATES ABOUT THIS PATCH"

if you read it you'd know.

Ok, , just because I couldn't be fucked reading  the patch, that doesn't mean that I didn't look at all the changes. What I meant by that was I didn't read ALL THE ENGLISH WORDS. but I looked at was actually important.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=gziarV7Z,comment-id=00080000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-15T06:23:06.021+0000)
>
> No, he's playing league, which the playability of league is what has been bitched about.

And this right here. Everyone is complaining about shit in the game that I'm finding no problems with, and neither should anyone else because for the amount of uproar that this patch has caused, most of the complaints I hear are tiny and dumb as fuck.

"**Everyone** is complaining about shit in the game that **I'm** finding no problems with"

so basically:

is it **me** or **everyone else** that is crazy?

mathematically... I'm sure you can draw your own conclusions there...

You kinda got me pretty good there, though it really was just a poor choice words on my part.

Look, all the people who are unhappy with this patch, I strongly believe, just hate change and need to have some patience. The changes will eventually grow on them, they'll get used to and love all the new stuff and Riot will eventually balance out all the over powered champions. I'm so sure because that's how it is every single patch.

Good reply though, solid. lol.

Thanks
I fully see where you are coming from tho, about people hating change, I know that a lot of the rage is about that.

I will admit to being biased because I hate just about everything they did in this patch, I like (in theory) what they did with graves but that's about it.

The adc change just feels unnecessary, it's like riot just went "crap it's pre-season again, how do we top last years new summoners rift? we need to do something big, but what should it be? Ok let's change around a few of the adc's, that'll be a laugh"

The warding change is little short of pathetic, they had a great system before with wards and trinkets and made warding a key element of doing well, and now it's like wtf...
(I do like the option of a non wasted space sightstone though) 


And the mana change is bs, like who honestly complained about mana last season? Seriously Where did that change come from?
The main complaints were "vayne's op" "yasuo's op" "juggernauts need a nerf" "it's too easy for teams to snowball" and riot took all that feedback and thought "we'll take away mana pots! That'll fix all these problems!"
Like seriously Mages were the least complained about thing the whole season and so now they all get massive mana gameplay changes? Like why??
Not to mention it screws up some top champs like kha and singed royally. It was a good system that no one complained about, why was this major change nessesary?



But don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining because it's all changed, I was massively for the new summoners rift, enhanced jungling/smite options, new support items, champion updates, new interesting (non brain dead) champs etc etc. 
I was against the HUD update but all the things I was complaining about with that were fixed later on so im ok with it now. I don't just complain because of change. I like change, But I don't think that this change is a good one. Not at all.

I too love what they did with Graves, I think tuning a champion to what they are lore-wise is really cool.

I don't know, I felt like the item diversity and a couple of reworks were in check. Just about every AD built the exact same items in the exact same order last season which sucked. And while some of the AD's had defined roles and strengths didn't really, or at least it felt like they didn't (I don't AD much)

Now there's something a was a little unhappy about, the removal of Stealth Wards. It feels like they're dumbing down the vision game and I don't like that. I feel like the team that has the initiative and wits to buy wards or upgrade their trinkets deserves the vision. But, I definitely love the slot efficient Sightstones too.

I honestly did not understand their justifications for the removal of mana pots in the Patch Notes, it was wierd. 

And I don't know man, I like a lot of these changes and even some of my champions were hurt a little in this patch.

As far as why they changed AD champs, I believe it is part of much larger scale changes that are still ongoing, after the Juggernaut updates, it became pretty clear they weren't gonna leave it there, and I don;t think they're gonna leave it here either. No'one really thought the Juggernaut changes were all that necessary but everyone got used to it in the end. It seems like there's a bigger end game (as end game as it can get on a game in permanent development) that we can't see yet because we don't have that inside perspective.

The item changes honestly were much needed, the ADC builds were so cookie cutter, there were 2 or three to pick from and that was it. The whole idea here is to diversify, make it so you can play the way YOU want, and the way that fits YOUR playstyle, instead of just going and copying pro guides. Heaven forbid they might make some of us actually use our brains to play this game ey...

As for the mana changes, I believe it was to compensate for the new masteries/refillables or something like that. On some champs I actually feel my mana conservation is if anything a little better than before the patch and all that had really changed on my end was masteries (and vaguely updated runes but no mana there, this is primarily in supp fyi). Now I don't know exactly why they changed mana, and as I don;t play champs like Singed I can't speak for them, but in supp and mid at least it doesn't seem to be having a negative impact...maybe I'm just used to playing with limited mana with the way I play. (supp main, i.e no blue buff, only early regen coming from spellthief's untill I get to something like Ardent or Morello)

Yeah I'm a mid lane main and I'm having no issues with the mana changes... 

The only two champions that I play on a regular basis who I've seen have suffered are Orianna and Morgana. But Ori's always had terrible mana issues which is really really annoying. I hope they fix it soon.
No, he's playing league, which the playability of league is what has been bitched about.
Thank you.

Ahaha true that. Even if it was broken, this is pre-season, it's supposed to be a time where Riot rolls out new changes and attempts to balance them before the actual season starts.

Surely no one could expect, Rift Herald, new AD items, ADC rework and ward rework to be perfectly balanced on release.

While this is true, I wouldn't be so irritated if people were only complaining about balance issues, but it's not that.

Everyone is just whining and crying and no one has even put up one point as to why they hate this patch so much.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} Ikr! I've given up reading boards for now, I don't need all this negativity in my life.

> [{quoted}](name=Junko,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=gziarV7Z,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-14T10:52:21.557+0000)
>
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} Ikr! I've given up reading boards for now, I don't need all this negativity in my life.

Yet here you are. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

> [{quoted}](name=Tiz Arrior,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=gziarV7Z,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-11-14T14:20:44.684+0000)
>
> Yet here you are. {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

ay

It's the same as every preseason. Last preseason they complained because SR was getting a visual overhaul and they didn't like it, many said they'd quit if it became permanent, and surprise surprise they are still playing all the way to this preseason and saying the exact same shit all over again.

All it really is, is the fashion of the internet these days, it's "indie" and "different" to complain about nothing rather than love something.
It's the same reason why people are bashing Fallout4. A couple of review sites gave FO4 mid range scores just to click bait people into visiting their sites because people think "Oh the trend is that everyone gives this game a great review, but this one didn't, I wanna know what they said about it" then surprise surprise those sites that gave the game a 5-7 out of 10 still say exactly the same thing as all the other reviewers giving said game a 10 out of 10.
The new Tomb Raider is getting that same treatment too.

Really the only way to deal with it is to downvote the people that do it so they don't get the attention they are seeking, because trust me once the preseason becomes the actual season these people will just complain about something else and never give anything substantial to their complaints.

Im actually loving this patch because the new guinsoos has brung back most of the ad to ap conversions that were killed long ago.

Such as ap yi, ap trynd, hell even ap ww is viable atm (granted im playing these at lower levels of play, but the fact i am carrying more consistently with these than i did any other champion before this patch should translate to people in most levels of play, especially champs like ap trynd and ap ww which technically require more micro management of this skills than their ad cousins)

Should be an interesting season indeed.
"brung" though

Colloquial english is still english.

Even if its not grammatically correct.
I've been a human being for 20 years, lived in three countries and in Australia for 10. I have never once seen or heard anyone use the term "brung" as a replacement for the word brought.
It's around, I used to hear it a lot more, not so much anymore...but maybe I just get out less...
Oh lol fair enough

The loss of mana pots/flask, and the new potions dont allow for sustain/defensive play like the flask did so some champs like singed really suffers, same with kha top. also the lack of AP in TRi-force now hurts champs like gnar and GP who now have no items to give them AP and so have useless scalings now.

not even mentioning that kog can take towers within seconds or that vayne/trist/jinx are no less played than before, which was the whole fucking purpose of this thing...

Ok, the loss of mana pots and flask was compensates for with boosted mana regen in Doran's, a new flask and buffed champion mana pools, I haven't had a single problem with anyone being too mana hungry from the loss of mana pots. Plus for defensive play, cull gives great sustain.

No. NO. 30 AP did NOTHING for ANYONE. Trust me, Gnar will much better use of the 10% CDR when in Gnar form and super permaslow in mini form.

If Kog can take towers in seconds thats fine, go with a heavy dive engage comp and that won't matter. Or really strong poke. There was no mention of those three ADs wanting to not be played anymore, not specifically anyway. And how are those three champions any fault of this patch?

There was no regen buff on AD melee champs that used it like Kha/GP etc etc, and Dorans ring isn't quite the optimum starting item for them.

If it did NOTHING for ANYONE then why did it stay in for 6 years? Gnar already has permaslow in mini form, and the megaform is designed so you dont spam abilities. trust me gnar is one of my main top laners. 

Its when he takes them while you arent there is the problem... have you noticed that your towers don't tend to be destroyed while you are sitting under them? they usually get destroyed while you are elsewhere.. 

as for there being no mention:
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/BcuB17WA-can-we-have-some-champion-diversity-please?comment=0005
"We have listened and **agreed** thats why we are making ALL these changes"

so the patch's fault is that it doesn't live up to its purpose of adding diversity to the adc pool. it was supped to get more adc's into play, yet its still those bs 3 that are being picked.

Ok, sure, there was no mana regen compensation for Kha and GP but the flasks were brought out, the corrupting one would be great for someone like Kha Zix as it would be for someone like GP seeing as his autos already burn. The items that these AD champions you're complaining about got, are insane, a little less mana regen in lane is a fair trade, I don't see a lane Kha Zix spamming that much anyway and GP has a mana refund for 50% on his Q. AND from memory, I see lots of Lane Kha's go Muramana anyway.

Because Sheen had 20 AP on it and to keep the Spellblade procs on it, you needed to build Sheen which needed to translate to the Trinity Force. Gnar has a 50% AP Ratio on his Ult and a 100% AP ratio on Hyper. You're losing 30 damage on Hyper and 15 on your ult. Your Hyper already does Max HP% damage, 30 isn't gonna affect him THAT much, I mean in a scrap you'll be proccing quite often but this is so miniscule I don't see how it's even worth bringing up like, GP also only loses like 27 HP on his W and THREE DAMAGE PER WAVE OF HIS ULT. In this entire patch you found 30 AP to complain about? It sounds like you're reaching. You will not even notice it dude. The 10% CDR benefits SO many more champions than 30 AP. And, I think it will benefit GP and Gnar more too. 

You leave your turret unattended with a Graves he'll do the same thing, a Caityn, a Tristana, a Jinx, a Quinn, a Talon, an Irelia, a Jax, an Udyr, a Sivir, an Ashe, they will all do the same thing. Kog even has AD reduction on his W to gate that. He kills them slightly faster. Slightly.

I'm sorry, I didn't see that post, my bad. 

And just wait, people will start to realise how strong these new ADs are and they'll pick them up. The problem is, people hate change, and it's doesn't seem like you're the biggest fan of it either. They're too used to playing what they like and what's safe, like Jinx and Tristana. As for Vayne, as long as Doublelift and hi im gosu play League of Legends, I'm sorry but people will still keep playing Vayne.

League of Legends is a big game we have so many champions and so many items now. As things get stronger, other things will get weaker that's just how it is and we have to accept that. It would be near impossible to make every single champion in the entire game strong and balanced. It was only weeks ago when Gangplank had a 100% pick/ban at Worlds and was destroying Solo Q in the hands of a good player, now, he suffers a little bit. But, did you ever see Miss Fortune get picked and do well? Well now she's strong as fuck. Syndra was dominant as hell last year, now she's non existent. Leblanc dissapeared for a while. When Fizz, Lissandra and Syndra all got nerfs at the start of this year, they were my favourite Solo Q champions and I was shattered, but I **moved on** because there's nothing you can do about it, endlessly complaining about how much Riot blew up the world will do nothing. I found new champions that I now love and I found what was strong and just went with it.

Riot HAS to change the Meta because when it was the Assassin meta everyone fucking cried. The Tank meta, everyone fucking cried, the Juggernauts, everyone fucking cried, hell people were crying that the mage meta was too fucking boring. Now that it's the time of the ADC's (and it's about fucking time they added a little spice to this role) everyone is fucking crying. People complain about one Meta and when it moves to another one they complain about that one. How else is Riot gonna keep making this game interesting? They're only humans.

Plus this is the PRE SEASON. Have some patience.

No patch ever is going to get people to stop playing Vayne. Doesn't matter what you do, you could make Vayne as pathetic as Quinn used to be,  and people will still play her.
Everyone who plays her is typically playing her because they want to emulate Dlift, which is why you always see the retards charge into a 1v5.

Tristana and Jinx are safe picks no matter the meta state, if they get fed they are powerful, if they don't they can still safely wave clear to catch back up.
Some ADC mains are afraid of trying anything new, thus they'll pick the familiar safe picks of Jinx and Trist.

There's a reason why it's called "PRE"season.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Akali. I dunno wtf they did but for some reason she has so much hp right now with no damage penalty
There was literally no changes to Akali from memory lol

sleeper buffs to her core items.

The hextech drinker change lets her heal off her passive now.

Among other things.
Right but 'hp'????
Her hp didn't actually go up, the hextech buff made her effective hp higher because she heals more now, which gives the illusion of a larger amount of hp.

In short:

Crit based AD champions got a massive buff. Yasuo only needs two items to obtain 100% crit chance, and once he hits that cap he basically gains 15% lifesteal and 20% attack speed every time he attacks. Same for Tryndamere, and same for Gangplank, to a lesser extent. Yi as well now hits like a truck, has excellent sustain in jungle and has items to increase his sticking power and mitigate damage thrown at him, whilst still being able to blow up everybody on your team due to True Damage procs with attack speed.

Graves is bonkers, doing insane damage if you aren't kalista and you are fighting anywhere other than the middle of lanes. On top of that he gets great tank stats from his E, but that's actually quite necessary to his new playstyle.

In general, ADC's can carry SO MUCH HARDER than they ever could before. It feels as though if you finish your first big item before your laner, you win the game.

Those are 3 points.

Ok, I 100% agree with the first point, Crit champions got the hugest buff this patch, but, as said before, this is the pre season, Riot fucked up and that's fine, they're only humans. I've seen people on here saying they're going to quit the game because of this patch.... It makes me wanna jump off a cliff. They're fixing it next patch, but even that, might not be enough, we'll see where they go with that.

Like I've said before, he looks ridiculous but, I've never had a problem with one, not yet, maybe because I play a lot of Assassins, I don't know, but people will find ways to deal with it.

And that's a bad a thing why? ADC'S have been like an objective themselves for ages, now, that objective fights back harder, makes the game more interesting. Riot wanted diversity, which was desperately needed since every game was IE-SHIV-LW-BT and it was dull as fuck, they may have overtuned some numbers, but they're easing back on some of the AD Carries next patch, it's already hit the PBE.
Only complain that's actually valid is how Graves is OP rn
I actually haven't seen one do that well yet

Too much buffs for AD, the number changes look good on paper, but in game they are doing too much. Some games I am getting 3 of them, one in each lane with the potential for a fourth in the jungle. That amount of fire power is quite a lot.

The patch has been out for like 3 days, I've had no problem with ADs being too strong. People will find ways to deal with them and these ways will reach you, chill. Graves is vulnerable and short range. Kog'Maw is basically stationary, MF is stationary when ulting etc etc.

I fking hate this patch one main reason is because of the zed changes they did
his dead now
might as well remove him from the game.

The W-Q combo is literally fine, it just requires you to actually aim the fucking thing now. I'm not the best Zed and I had absolutely no problem hitting it. 

The itemisation improvements FAR FAR FAR outweighed the removal of the faster WQ.

Plus he's getting some pretty good buffs next patch. In the PBE right now, his W range is going from 600 to 700 and the Death Mark damage is going from 20%/35%/50% to 30%/40%/50%.

His level 6 is gonna be ridiculous now.

Zed is in a better spot than he has been in ages. Go play like 4 games, get used to the combo and realise how fucking great his itemisation options are right now.
